items.title: Even as stocks slide, Wall Street is at ‘historically extreme valuations,’ warns Apollo chief economist
items.description: The latest data underlines a broader concern among analysts that a reckoning is looming for the markets.

items.title: Mark Zuckerberg says ‘The Social Network’ nailed his wardrobe: ‘Every single shirt or fleece they had in that movie is a shirt or fleece that I own’
items.description: Zuckerberg even bought one of the shirts worn by actor Jesse Eisenberg, on auction, for over $4,000.

items.title: Gen Alpha won’t ever have to write an email when they join the workforce, new research reveals—they’ll be sending voice notes to their boss instead
items.description: LSE researchers say Gen Alpha will talk, not type at work—they predict that voice notes will make keyboard practically obsolete by 2030.

items.title: Elon Musk’s $1 trillion pay package and the race to the bottom among states with weak corporate governance laws
items.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

items.title: How Macy’s, Dillard’s, and Nordstrom are getting their groove back
items.description: Department stores have a new playbook to win back shoppers from discount stores and Amazon.
